about: I enjoy creating minimalistic digital products which improve our lives. Somewhere between product design and implementation I feel most at home. Problem solving is my second nature, zooming in or out whenever that's needed, never losing sight of users and stakeholders.

After dropping out of high school I started working at the age of 18 in administrative roles, mainly because I was a late bloomer and felt out of place in the education system with an abundance of creativity and somewhat stubborn intuition. Once I had to work with computers I was hooked and started learning programming at home, never looking back.

After 24 years my work still doesn't feel like work to me. You can find me behind my laptop a lot, creating things and studying adjacent areas like design and 3D software. If I really want to disconnect I enjoy movies, photography and drawing on actual paper with color pencils.

positions.title: Full Stack Developer
positions.description: Worked on various proofs of concepts for iOS/macOS/web apps powered by self developed backends running on NodeJS. I liked the freedom I got here developing all sorts of concepts. The downside was being the only developer, which felt isolated when working fully remote also. I decided to move on, since working together with other builders has my preference.

positions.title: iOS Developer
positions.description: Maintained and improved the native iOS app in bi-weekly Scrum sprints, built using Swift. The composition of the mobile team changed a lot while I worked here. Unfortunately COVID19 struck us quite hard and I decided it was time to move on to keep growing.

positions.title: iOS Developer
positions.description: Responsible for development, improvements and maintenance of the company’s native iOS app, built using Swift. I enjoyed working for this startup a lot being the first employee. Unfortunately our Series B investment didn't came through due to a personal tragedy of a key investor.

positions.title: iOS Developer
positions.description: Responsible for maintenance of the company’s native iOS E-commerce app, built using Objective-C. In parallel a brand we started a new version of the app using Swift in cooperation with fellow developers in Vilnius, Lithuania. We were acquired by a competitor and we had to downsize, hence my decision to move on.

positions.title: iOS Developer
positions.description: Co-responsible for development and maintenance of the company’s native iOS app, built using Objective-C. This was my first stretch being a mobile developer. It was for the whole team and we had a lot of fun breaking ground and figuring things out together.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Improved an in-house developed Windows touchscreen based desktop shell, built using Qt/C++

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Responsible for development of touchscreen based software for a room filling installation for Paleis Het Loo, built using Qt/C++. Also worked on a mobile web application for Naturalis, built using HTML/CSS/JS, and the company website using Wordpress.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Developed and maintained software applications for in-house developed self-service kiosks. We also developed a remote kiosk management system, custom Windows desktop shell and certified unmanned payment system, all using Qt/C++.

positions.title: Full Stack Developer
positions.description: Developed applications for in-house developed Saas based CRM for the real estate industry, built using PHP5 and HTML/CSS/JS.

positions.title: Full Stack Developer
positions.description: Co-responsible for design, development and maintenance of the hospital’s web-based patient information system, built using C++, Java and HTML/CSS/JS.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Responsible for design, development and maintenance of applications running on touchscreen based Windows computers, built using C/C++.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Responsible for design, development and maintenance of applications running on touchscreen based Windows computers, built using C/C++.
